course.description_en: Meet the special people who help us every day in our community. Learn about doctors, firefighters, teachers, and other helpers who keep us safe and happy.
course.description_ar: تعرف على الأشخاص المميزين الذين يساعدوننا كل يوم في مجتمعنا. تعلم عن الأطباء ورجال الإطفاء والمعلمين وغيرهم من المساعدين الذين يحافظون على سلامتنا وسعادتنا.
course.subject: social_studies

content_data.title: Dr. Sarah Takes Care of Everyone
content_data.content: Meet Dr. Sarah! She is a doctor. Doctors help people feel better. Dr. Sarah wears a white coat. She has a stethoscope around her neck. The stethoscope listens to your heart. Thump thump, thump thump! Dr. Sarah is very kind. When you feel sick, she helps you. She checks your temperature. She looks in your ears. She makes sure you are healthy. Dr. Sarah gives medicine to help you feel better. She tells you to rest and drink water. Thank you, Dr. Sarah, for taking care of us!
learning_objectives: Identify what doctors do to help people
Recognize doctor tools and clothing
Understand doctors help us when we're sick

vocabulary_words.definition: Person who helps sick people feel better
Tool doctors use to listen to your heart
Special help that makes sick people better
Feeling good and strong, not sick
How hot or cold your body is
Nice and caring to other people

materials_needed: White shirt or coat for dress-up
content_data.parent_guidance: Let child play doctor with teddy bear. Demonstrate listening to heartbeat gently. Explain that doctors help us and are not scary. Use positive, reassuring language about doctor visits. Practice being gentle with 'patient'.
safety_notes: Use only safe, large toy medical instruments
Ensure teddy bear is clean and safe
discussion_questions: What does a doctor wear?
How do doctors help us?
What does a stethoscope do?

extension_activities.title: Teddy Bear Hospital
extension_activities.description: Set up pretend hospital and take care of stuffed animals.

extension_activities.title: Doctor Tools Match
extension_activities.description: Match pictures of doctor tools to what they do.

content_data.title: Captain Mike Fights Fires
content_data.content: Meet Captain Mike the firefighter! Firefighters are very brave. They help when there are fires. Captain Mike wears a special helmet. His helmet is hard and keeps his head safe. He wears heavy boots and a big coat. The coat protects him from fire. Captain Mike rides in a big red fire truck. The fire truck has a loud siren. Wee-ooh, wee-ooh! It has long hoses to spray water. Water puts out fires. Captain Mike also helps rescue people. He climbs tall ladders. He is strong and brave. Let's practice being firefighters! Put on your helmet! Climb the ladder! Spray water on the fire! Thank you, Captain Mike!
learning_objectives: Learn what firefighters do to help people
Identify firefighter equipment and vehicles
Practice firefighter movements safely

vocabulary_words.definition: Brave person who puts out fires and saves people
Hard hat that protects your head
Big red truck that carries water to put out fires
Loud sound that warns people emergency vehicle is coming
Save someone who needs help
Not scared, willing to help even when it's dangerous

content_data.parent_guidance: Emphasize how firefighters help people. Let child practice climbing step stool safely with supervision. Make siren sounds together. Demonstrate spraying water motion with pretend hose. Keep focus on helping others.
safety_notes: Ensure helmet fits properly if used
Keep climbing activities low and safe
Hold child's hand during ladder practice
discussion_questions: What do firefighters wear to stay safe?
What sound does a fire truck make?
How do firefighters put out fires?

extension_activities.title: Fire Safety Practice
extension_activities.description: Practice stop, drop, and roll and calling for help.

extension_activities.title: Fire Truck Building
extension_activities.description: Build fire truck with blocks or boxes and pretend to drive to help people.

content_data.title: Miss Emma Teaches Every Day
content_data.content: Meet Miss Emma! She is a teacher. Teachers help children learn new things. Miss Emma works at a school. She has a big classroom with desks and chairs. Miss Emma reads books to her students. She teaches letters and numbers. A, B, C and 1, 2, 3! She shows pictures and tells stories. Miss Emma is very patient. She helps children when they don't understand. She smiles a lot and uses a kind voice. Miss Emma has books, crayons, and paper. She helps children draw and write. At the end of the day, she says goodbye with a wave. Thank you, Miss Emma, for helping us learn!
learning_objectives: Understand what teachers do to help children
Identify classroom items and learning tools
Appreciate teachers' role in learning

vocabulary_words.definition: Person who helps children learn new things
Place where children go to learn
Room where teacher teaches children
Child who comes to school to learn
Calm and kind, not rushing or getting angry
Find out new things and remember them

content_data.parent_guidance: Set up pretend classroom with child as teacher. Let child 'teach' you letters or numbers. Practice reading books together. Emphasize how teachers are helpers who care about children. Make learning fun and positive.
safety_notes: Supervise use of pointer - no hitting
Keep classroom setup safe and organized
discussion_questions: What does a teacher do?
Where do teachers work?
How do teachers help you learn?

extension_activities.title: Play School
extension_activities.description: Set up classroom and take turns being teacher and student.
materials: Dolls or stuffed animals as students

extension_activities.title: Thank You Teacher
extension_activities.description: Draw picture or make card to thank a teacher you know.

content_data.title: Officer Tom Helps Everyone
content_data.content: Meet Officer Tom! He is a police officer. Police officers keep everyone safe. Officer Tom wears a special uniform. It has a badge that shines. The badge shows he is a police officer. He has a hat and strong boots. Officer Tom drives a police car. It has flashing lights and a siren. The lights help people see him coming. Officer Tom helps find lost children. He helps people cross the street safely. He makes sure everyone follows the rules. Officer Tom is friendly and helpful. He waves to children and smiles. If you ever need help, you can ask a police officer. They are there to help you!
learning_objectives: Learn how police officers help keep people safe
Identify police uniform and equipment
Understand police officers are helpers we can trust

vocabulary_words.definition: Person who helps keep everyone safe and follows rules
Special clothes that show what job someone has
Shiny thing police officers wear to show their job
Important things we must do to stay safe
When you can't find your way home
Believe someone will help you and keep you safe

content_data.parent_guidance: Emphasize that police officers are helpers, not scary. Practice crossing street safely. Explain when and how to ask police for help. Role-play meeting a friendly police officer. Keep all interactions positive.
safety_notes: Use only safe toy police equipment
Practice safety rules in controlled environment
discussion_questions: How do police officers help us?
What does a police officer wear?
When might you ask a police officer for help?

extension_activities.title: Safety Rules Practice
extension_activities.description: Practice looking both ways, holding hands when crossing street.

extension_activities.title: Community Helper Parade
extension_activities.description: March around as different community helpers with their tools.

content_data.title: Mr. Carlos Delivers the Mail
content_data.content: Meet Mr. Carlos! He is a mail carrier. Mail carriers bring letters and packages to our homes. Mr. Carlos has a big bag full of mail. He walks from house to house every day. Mr. Carlos wears comfortable shoes for walking. He has a hat to protect him from sun and rain. He drives a mail truck that stops at every mailbox. Mr. Carlos puts letters in the mailbox. He brings packages to the door. Sometimes he brings birthday cards! Sometimes he brings important letters for grown-ups. Mr. Carlos knows every house on his route. He waves and says hello to everyone. Thank you, Mr. Carlos, for bringing our mail!
learning_objectives: Understand what mail carriers do for the community
Learn about letters, packages, and mailboxes
Appreciate daily services that help families

vocabulary_words.definition: Person who brings letters and packages to your house
Messages written on paper and sent to people
Boxes with things inside sent to people
Special box where mail carrier puts your letters
Path mail carrier takes to visit all the houses
Feeling good, not hurt or sore

materials_needed: Toy mail bag or large bag
content_data.parent_guidance: Let child play mail carrier delivering letters around the house. Practice writing or drawing on envelopes. Explain how mail gets from one person to another. Show real mailbox outside if safe to do so.
safety_notes: Ensure mail bag isn't too heavy for child
Keep all mail play indoors unless supervised
discussion_questions: What does a mail carrier bring us?
Where does the mail carrier put letters?
How does mail get to our house?

extension_activities.title: Family Mail Delivery
extension_activities.description: Deliver pretend letters to family members around the house.

extension_activities.title: Thank You Card Making
extension_activities.description: Make thank you cards for community helpers learned so far.

lessons.title_en: Grocery Store Worker Helps Us Shop
lessons.title_ar: عامل متجر البقالة يساعدنا في التسوق

content_data.title: Ms. Rosa Helps at the Store
content_data.content: Meet Ms. Rosa! She works at the grocery store. Grocery store workers help us find food to buy. Ms. Rosa stocks the shelves with food. She puts apples with apples. She puts milk in the cold section. Ms. Rosa helps customers find what they need. 'Where are the bananas?' 'Right here!' she says with a smile. She works at the checkout too. Beep, beep, beep! She scans the food. She puts groceries in bags carefully. Ms. Rosa makes sure the store is clean and organized. She helps make shopping easy for families. Let's play grocery store! We can stock shelves and help customers too!
learning_objectives: Learn how grocery store workers help communities
Understand shopping and food organization
Practice helping and organizing skills

vocabulary_words.definition: Place where families buy food and things they need
Long flat places in store where food sits
People who come to buy things at the store
Place where you pay for things you want to buy
Everything in the right place, neat and tidy
Use special tool to read the price of food

content_data.parent_guidance: Set up pretend grocery store with empty containers. Let child be both worker and customer. Practice organizing items by type. Emphasize being helpful and polite. Make shopping fun and educational.
safety_notes: Use only empty, clean food containers
Ensure no sharp edges on containers
Keep play money large enough to be safe
Check that all props are age-appropriate
discussion_questions: What does Ms. Rosa do at the store?
How do grocery store workers help us?
Where do we pay for our food?

extension_activities.title: Store Organization Game
extension_activities.description: Sort play food into groups - fruits, vegetables, milk products.

extension_activities.title: Shopping List Adventure
extension_activities.description: Make picture shopping list and 'shop' for items in pretend store.

content_data.title: Who Helps Us in Our Community?
content_data.content: Let's play a fun game about all the community helpers we learned about! I will ask you questions about the special people who help us every day. You can point to pictures or tell me the answers!
learning_objectives: Review all community helpers learned
Match helpers to their tools and jobs
Show understanding of how helpers serve community

vocabulary_words.definition: Fun game with questions about what you learned
All the people who live and work near you

materials_needed: Pictures of their tools and vehicles
content_data.parent_guidance: Show pictures clearly and give child time to think. Accept pointing or simple words as answers. Use encouraging tone throughout. Celebrate every response positively. Help child connect helpers to their jobs.
safety_notes: Keep quiz atmosphere fun and pressure-free
Take breaks if child seems tired
discussion_questions: Who helps us when we are sick?
Point to the person who puts out fires!
Who teaches children at school?
Which helper keeps us safe and follows rules?
Who brings letters to our house?
Point to the person who helps us buy food!
What does a doctor use to listen to your heart?
What vehicle does a firefighter drive?
Where does a teacher work?
What does a mail carrier carry?

extension_activities.title: Helper Tools Match
extension_activities.description: Match pictures of tools to the right community helper.

extension_activities.title: Community Helper Charades
extension_activities.description: Act out what different helpers do while others guess.

content_data.title: Celebrating All Our Community Helpers
content_data.content: Let's celebrate all the wonderful people who help us every day! Dr. Sarah helps us feel better when we're sick. Captain Mike keeps us safe from fires. Miss Emma helps us learn new things. Officer Tom protects us and keeps everyone safe. Mr. Carlos brings our mail every day. Ms. Rosa helps us buy food at the store. All these helpers make our community a better place to live! They work hard every day to help families. Let's say thank you to each helper! 'Thank you, Doctor!' 'Thank you, Firefighter!' 'Thank you, Teacher!' 'Thank you, Police Officer!' 'Thank you, Mail Carrier!' 'Thank you, Store Worker!' We can help others too! We can be kind. We can share. We can help clean up. We can be good community helpers!
learning_objectives: Review and appreciate all community helpers learned
Understand how helpers make community better
Learn ways children can help their community too

vocabulary_words.definition: Be happy and thankful for something special
Place where we live with all our neighbors
Keep safe from danger or harm
Be thankful and understand how good something is
Nice and caring to other people
Let others use or have some of what you have

materials_needed: All props and costumes from previous lessons
content_data.parent_guidance: Help child try on different helper costumes and act out their jobs. Make thank you cards together for real community helpers you know. Take photos of child as different helpers. Discuss ways your family helps the community.
safety_notes: Keep celebration activities calm and organized
Use safe art supplies for card making
discussion_questions: Which community helper is your favorite?
How do all these helpers make our town better?
What can you do to help others?

extension_activities.title: Community Helper Book
extension_activities.description: Make book with pictures of all helpers and what they do.

extension_activities.title: Real Helper Visit
extension_activities.description: Plan to visit or invite real community helper to meet child.

extension_activities.title: Family Helper Plan
extension_activities.description: Make plan for how family can help community (picking up litter, etc.).
